attributes.description: This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-003878, focusing on monitoring data source diversity. This visualization displays the health status of data source diversity based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.name: <your_component_name>' or 'event.provider: <provider_name>' to focus on specific systems or data sources. Observe the trends and individual anomaly events. A high anomaly score indicates a significant deviation from the established baseline, which could signify unexpected changes in the types or volume of data sources being monitored, potentially impacting the comprehensiveness of your security monitoring.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-003878] Data Source Diversity Monitoring ML

attributes.description:
This visualization provides a time-series trend of incoming logs, stacked by the data source (`event.provider`).

**Why and when this visualization works:**
This chart is crucial for verifying the *consistency* of your data sources. Correlation and analysis are only effective if the underlying data is reliable and continuous. This view makes it immediately obvious if a data source has stopped reporting, which would create a critical blind spot.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Look for stable, continuous bands of color. If a color representing a critical data source suddenly disappears, it signifies a logging outage that must be investigated. Use the time selector to zoom in on specific periods where you suspect an issue. A healthy trend shows all expected sources reporting without significant interruption.
attributes.title: [CCI-003878] Data Ingestion Trend (converted)

attributes.description:
This visualization shows the proportional breakdown of log records by their source (`event.provider`).

**Why and when this visualization works:**
This chart is essential for understanding the balance of your data sources.
While it's expected for some sources (like firewalls or endpoint agents) to be 'chatty', a healthy system will show a variety of active sources.
If one source completely dominates the view, it may indicate that other, less frequent sources are being overlooked in analysis.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Use this chart to visually confirm the presence of all critical data sources.
Hover over the slices to see the specific counts. If a critical source (e.g., 'cloudtrail', 'sysmon') represents a very small slice or is grouped into 'Other', you may need to investigate its logging configuration or use filters to create a more focused view.
attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-003878] Data Source Distribution

attributes.description: This visualization displays the health status of OS family diversity based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.os.family: <os_family_name>' to focus on a specific operating system family. Observe the trends and individual anomaly events. A high anomaly score indicates a significant deviation from the established baseline, which could signify unexpected changes in the types or volume of operating systems being monitored, potentially impacting the comprehensiveness of your security monitoring.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-003878] OS Family Diversity Monitoring ML

attributes.description:
This visualization displays the total number of unique Operating System families (`host.os.family`) from which logs are being collected.

**Why and when this visualization works:**
This metric confirms that your data correlation efforts span across different environments (e.g., Windows, Linux, macOS).
It's a key indicator that you have visibility across your entire operational landscape, not just a single type of system.
This is crucial for understanding the system's security state in heterogeneous environments.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Check this number to ensure all expected OS families are represented.
If your organization uses Windows, Linux, and cloud services, you should see a count of at least 3. If a family is missing, it points to a critical visibility gap that must be addressed.
attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-003878] OS Family Diversity
attributes.visState: {"title":"[CA-7 / CCI-003878] OS Family Diversity","type":"metric","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"cardinality","params":{"field":"host.os.family","emptyAsNull":false},"schema":"metric"}],"params":{"addTooltip":true,"addLegend":false,"type":"metric","metric":{"percentageMode":false,"useRanges":false,"colorSchema":"Green to Red","metricColorMode":"None","colorsRange":[{"from":0,"to":10000}],"labels":{"show":true},"style":{"fontSize":60,"bgColor":false,"labelColor":false,"subText":"Unique OS Families"}}}}

attributes.description:
This visualization displays the total number of unique data sources (`event.provider`) sending logs into the system.

**Why and when this visualization works:**
This metric provides a direct, at-a-glance measurement of the breadth of your data collection, which is the foundation for correlation and analysis.
Use it as a quick health check to ensure your monitoring scope is as wide as you expect.
A higher number is generally better, indicating a more diverse set of inputs for security analysis.

**How an analyst can use it:**
Monitor this number over time.
A sudden decrease could indicate a significant failure in a logging pipeline or that a data source has gone offline, which would directly impact your ability to correlate data and meet this control.
attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-003878] Data Source Diversity
attributes.visState: {"title":"[CA-7 / CCI-003878] Data Source Diversity","type":"metric","aggs":[{"id":"1","enabled":true,"type":"cardinality","params":{"field":"event.provider","emptyAsNull":false},"schema":"metric"}],"params":{"addTooltip":true,"addLegend":false,"type":"metric","metric":{"percentageMode":false,"useRanges":false,"colorSchema":"Green to Red","metricColorMode":"None","colorsRange":[{"from":0,"to":10000}],"labels":{"show":true},"style":{"fontSize":60,"bgColor":false,"labelColor":false,"subText":"Unique Data Sources"}}}}
